column4: Hi, my sound was working fine in Ubuntu and now it doesn't.  How do I re-install sound drivers?
when and how did this happen
tonight.  I don't know if it was related to the update that ubuntu installed or not.
I have rebooted but know nothing about alsa
try typing "/etc/init.d/alsamixer restart" in a terminal
bash: /etc/init.d/alsamixer: No such file or directory
type cd then type alsamixer restart
it brings up a screen with level bars on it
yes it should have restarted it now turn all the levels up and see if it worked
how do I move from one to the other?
ok turned all up.  sound pref tab is still open and is locked up.
try this "/etc/rc.d/init.d/alsasound stop" then do this "/etc/rc.d/init.d/alsasound start"
hmm i have no clue why that command isnt working
I don't seem to have that directory, are you sure it's the correct one?
